name: Kauai Marriott Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful hotel and an amazing pool area, unmatched anywhere in the Islands.
reviews.title: Amazing Pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Delays at front desk because of insufficient staff...so prepare to wait.
reviews.title: No Idea What customer Service Means
Marriott vacation club/Marriott Kauai Lagoon
reviews.text: In our building, one of two elevators was out-of-service the entire 4 days we were there. There seemed to be a very slow pace set and accepted by management. Very unusual for a high qualify Marriott.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a failure of customer service! We were there on a five night package and had a problem with our room. It was like they couldn't be bothered to deal with it (they didn't), but what made it really bad, was their total lack of communication and caring. Other than that, the property is nice so long as you don't mind listening to planes taking off from the airport at Lihue, which is practically next door.
reviews.title: Close to airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is one of the most fantastic Marriott vacation properties. The 2 bedroom unit has 2 full bedrooms, each with a king bed. The kitchen is so well appointed- Sub Zero refrigerator and top of the line appliances. Large living room, good size dining area and beautiful large lanai that is screened in and has a sun shade offering sun protection. Lovely grounds, very accommodating staff and shuttle. Very close to the airport. A little confusing at first, to find the property, but worth the trip. I WILL be back!
reviews.title: Great resort.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: One of the most comfortable hotels we've stayed at since the Hotel George in D.C.--and we travel a fair amount. It was also one of the most strikingly beautiful. Our colleagues became violently ill though, having fish at the grill by the pool. We also ate there a few times, and had no problems. So, who knows, she could have eaten something else that was tainted before she arrived. If we return to Kauai, we will definitely stay here. Lots of great restaurants all around and on site. Some shopping is walking distance. The unusually large and beautiful pool in view of the ocean is paradise.
reviews.title: Like Nights at the Museum...with a Magnificent Pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from staying at Marriott Kauai Resort. We arrived and the their shuttle was there shortly, took us through a back road that is absolutely gorgeous!! beautiful trees, cute rusters walking all over, inmmaculate gardens!! Bellmen were very helpful, explaining where we would go to check in, helpful with our luggage. Receptionist was fast and very nice. Special thanks to CHAD (concergie) he explained us how to take a bus to get a pizza at a restaurant that we had heard of, BRICK OVEN PIZZA, and another time helped me with a phone call, he is an excellent employee and person!!! We got a comfortable room but because we were EXCHANGE from timeshare, we got garden view, ground floor, hidden in a corner, I was afraid to sit in my patio because I didn't know what was going to crawl out of the bushes!!!We requested second floor, at least, but it was very full, and for all the seven nights that we were getting we had a terrific price per night, so we understood and enjoyed our room very much. It was very roomy, we had two full bathrooms, two big screen T.V.'s and it was a one bedroom with living room, kitchennette, etc. Very clean, very nice bed!!! Crispy sheets!! The whole place is beautiful!!! Very clean!!! You can tell that it has its years but over all is very nice!! Very nice gym!!! Always found a machine and plenty of room to work out!! Portofino, Dukes, KuKui's very good restaurants, every meal was great!!! I got up early to go for walks on the beach or around the property, beach, etc. and the employees that I encounter always greeted me with a smile!!! Always asking if I need it anything!!! The airport is two miles away and YOU CAN'T HEAR THE PLANES!!!! I am a young person very good hearing, the only thing that you hear sometimes is the rusters, sometimes loud!! Nothing to bother so much.....Overall, a very nice vacation!!!
reviews.title: Almost everything was perfect!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Five day stay. Beautiful pool and beach area. Enjoyed adjoining area with restaurants outside of hotel. Helpful staff, nice room. Only negative comment is that this is an older property which has been renovated. Could use interior repainting. Good central location.
reviews.title: Beautiful Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed five days. Impeccable service. They honored an early check-in request. One morning I walked one lap around the lobby, looking for the morning newspaper. An employee noticed I was trying to find something, stopped his vacuum walked across the room and asked me if he could help me. Everyone at this hotel smiles when they help you. Even the bellhops after we tell them we are self-parking.
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Forget the amazing setting, relaxing pool area and beach and walking access to off-property services, the service was what really stuck out. In five days only had one complaint, the line at the front desk took me 10 minutes just to get a dead room key re-programmed.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Without doubt, the Marriott has beautiful grounds - starting from the moment you drive in, there is a beautiful canopy, the huge swimming pool faces the mountains and ocean, etc - the view is just absolutely splendid.
reviews.title: Fantastic Grounds, but Smelly Bathrooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let's move to the rooms - they are very outdated. I know a lot of the previous reviews talk about the Marriott timeshare, and i have no doubt that their timeshares are in great shape. But their ordinary hotel rooms leave a lot to be desired. At first they booked us in a small room facing the garden and there were stains on their ceiling, the bathtub didn't drain and the bathroom smelled gross - it was because they are still using cloth shower curtains. I complained to the front desk and they upgraded us to a suite, facing the pool. Yes, this room was nicer, but the bathrooms still used cloth shower curtains - i think the last time i saw cloth shower curtains was at Ramada Inn - seriously, Marriott needs to get with the times.
reviews.title: Helicopter noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012
reviews.text: So even though the room was more spacious, the bathrooms stank and they just need to upgrade to glass doors - that will help with the odor. I spent 60,000 Marriott points to stay here for 2 nights and wouldn't do it again.
reviews.title: Very large but gorgeous hotel in paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have loved staying at the Marriott Kauai Resort in Lihue, HI for many years. The pool is wonderful, resturants great, beach clean and very relaxing. This past May however, we were shocked that the helicopter noise began at 8:01 AM every morning and continued until 5:00PM. Evidently the helicopters have been rerouted to fly directly over the Marriott at low altitiude making it impossible to relax. When I asked the front desk they said that they were unaware of such noise. One morning, I observed the head of security looking up and asked him what was with the noise and he just shook his head.
reviews.title: Wonderful ocean view relaxation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in a 1 bedroom oceanfront villa for 1 week. Weather was perfect. Our view on the 5th floor was amazing. Cleaning staff was very helpful. The larger pool bar that opens at 4 had good food and drinks during happy hour. 5 hot tubs by the pool were nice. Lots of people. If you are looking for quiet go elsewhere but otherwise very nice place.
reviews.title: Very Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hey everyone! We had the privilege of spending Christmas in Hawaii. We have stayed here numerous times in the past. This time for a much longer stay... through the new year. This is a beautiful relaxing resort. We are golfers so we played a lot of golf. Our only problem was the increase in the costs of food and beverages. They do offer a better deal at the coffee bar where one cup is $5.50. They offer a mug that is very tall(12oz) for $39.95 with all the refills you want. For a 14 day stay this more than paid for itself. You can also request a toaster, larger refrigerator(dorm size) and a microwave. If you have a car, Walmart is easy to find. I strongly urge you to purchase your drinks, bread, lunch meats, butter for toast, condiments and snacks to save money. We found a group of little restaurants & bars within walking distance across Rice Street at the end of the beach area. They are much more reasonable. If you want great food and ambiance Dukes and the Italian restaurant at the hotel is worth a little extra. If all you want to do is lay on the beach, get there early to claim the chairs. ALOHA!:)
reviews.title: Hawaiian Christmas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in Kauai for a wedding in October 2012 and decied to stay in Lihue because it was central to all the planned activities. The hotel overall was good. The first few nights we stayed in an ocean front room and the view was fabulous. My only complaint is that they don't have chairs in the room to relax in and enjoy the view! There is one desk chair and that's it! The other 2 nights we used points for a 1 bedroom villa. The room itself was very large, but unfortunately, it was tucked away with very very little view and it was dark. The pool area is super, especially for kids. The beach is very nice/clean, but too violent for little ones. Our only huge disappointment was the so-called sushi bar on the property--over-priced and underwhelming. We did however have the Feral Pig Burger at the Feral Pig pub and it was delish. We tried to play tennis at the sister property, but the courts are not maintained at all (I don't think they even advertise it on the website).
reviews.title: Convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed at this facility back in 2007 and reviewed it then as well.
reviews.title: As beautiful as ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a huge mega-resort and by no means is it the quiet little out of the way place. It sports it's own large beach, gigantic pool, several large buildings as well as multiple eating options. The grounds are absolutely exquisite and feature native plants and a large Koi Pond. The lobby is gorgeous and the staff is absolutely ready to be of assistance.
reviews.title: Really happy with this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While it is not out of the ordinary to pay for things at 4 and 5 star resorts, it's still a bit annoying at times. The business center for example charges 35c a minute to use their computers which I personally think is inappropriate. The hotel no longer cleans rooms on a daily basis but rather does a periodic tidy-up. Honestly, this is probably all that is truly necessary and perhaps we all became spoiled by a daily cleaning and sheet change but if you want to extra cleaning, it can be had for $60 according to their printed material.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great two bedroom/living room suite, with an absolutely gorgeous view. We felt like we were in a dream...the weather was gorgeous each day, the staff was wonderful, restaurant great and we just didn't want to leave. We are scheduled to go back in March of 2009 and can't wait. Worth every penny. Just wish we could stay longer!
reviews.title: Paradise Found

likes.liked: — The resort is elegant yet relaxing and comfortable
likes.disliked: — There wasn't anything...just wish we had brought our friends for the extra bedroom!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel does have a nice pool and apparently has some nice rooms, but be very cautious if you make your reservation with an internet web site- because our room was bad and did not meet our expectations.
reviews.title: Beware of internet reservations - they have some bad rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived the front desk clerk gave us room 470. The room was very small, smelled moldy, had old dirty carpet and looked at a wall and some oil drums. Also, the small window did not open.
reviews.title: Good location, Awesome pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: When I returned to the front desk to request a better room, the clerk told me that I could get a better room, but I would need to pay an additional $80-$150 per night, on top of what I had already paid. She also told me that most people assigned to the type of room they gave me do agree to pay the additional amount, because they don't want to stay in the bad rooms. She said that people that book through the internet often get the bad rooms, but when they see the rooms they will agree to pay more. I was not happy with the business practice of selling a "garden view" room that looks at a wall and oil drums, with the hope that people will hate it so much that they agree to pay an additional $80-$150 per night.
reviews.title: Great Hotel-Beautiful resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: After much persistence on my part, I was moved to another very small, smelly room with old dirty carpet and a that window did not open, but I was then above the oil drums and wall, so I could see some day light.
reviews.title: A week in paradise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Without getting into details, please read the lower reviews on this hotel. We had several issues, none of which were dealt with. The desk clerks kept mentioning that because they are a time share destination they lack resources to address normal guests. The location is way out of the way so unless you have something nearby to point you to this hotel go to the other Marriott on kauai or another brand altogether. This hotel is seriously dated although it was really the customer service that stood out as simply terrible.
reviews.title: Go Elsewhere or risk ruining your Hawaii vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Marriott for 4 nights in late January. I was a little bit crazy in assessing TripAdvisor reviews prior to our trip, trying to make sure we got the biggest 'bang for our buck', and I'm really happy we chose the Marriott.
reviews.title: Disappointed in other reviewers - awesome stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - AMAZING landscaping. Grounds are absolutely beautiful. You drive down a long driveway with beautiful trees making a tunnel of sorts, with beautiful flowers and such along the way. My boyfriend was obsessed with the courtyard in the middle of the property, which had dozens (maybe hundreds) of koi fish swimming around.
reviews.title: Great beach, lovely resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Dukes. We loved the on-site restaurant. Sure, it's not 5-star dining, but it's a beach-side bar/restaurant. If you want the "Forgetting Sarah Marshall"-esque beach-side dining experience, Dukes has it. Good salad bar too.
reviews.title: Average all around, 3 star property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband, 20 year old son and I went to this Marriott March 9-14th, 2008. Kauai’s Marriott is topnotch. The resort is absolutely beautiful. It does not look aged or in disrepair by any means. The pool is gorgeous. It is huge, with over 2 million 1 X 1 inch tiles in it. There are 4 cool lion fountains in the pool that spout water out into the pool. There are 5 whirlpools in the vicinity of the large pool along with a child’s pool. The beach front is more than adequate for the resort, with a beautiful view. Chairs at both the pool and beach front were always available, along with towels. You do need to give a beach card in exchange for towels each day. There are 5 restaurants on site, all beautifully decorated as well. We ate twice at Dukes restaurant for dinner and once for lunch. Food was excellent. The prices on the resort were not any different than others on Kauai that we encountered; with the exception of breakfast. The Beach Hut, located behind the Marriott does indeed serve excellent breakfasts for less than $8 with Kauai coffee. In the room is a dorm size frig if you want to buy some items for snacking on. There is Kauai coffee to brew, along with Hawaiian teas, restocked each day. Each morning we went out briefly and before we returned to the room housekeeping had already freshened the room up. We did have to pay for self parking ($9/day). Would definitely return to this resort if on Kauai again.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

likes.disliked: — Charge for internet access and parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel is older but it is kept up well. There are nicer hotels in Puipu Beach area and weather is a little nicer. I don't why tripadvisor doesnt promote so many other hotels that are available on the Island. I am a big Tripadvsor fan but I was very disappointed that they did not show all the options.
reviews.title: Hotel Nice-Island too quiet for us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We liked the Marriot fine in Lihue. The Marriot in Puipu is much newer and the beach is beautiful.
reviews.title: 5 star resort - 3.5 star rooms

likes.liked: — The resort area itself (pool and beach).
likes.disliked: — The room itself (see review for details).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was friendly for the most part. The pool was pretty and the beach was the calmest we saw on the island, good for kids. We had great weather but many talked about how the weather can be bad on Kauai.
reviews.title: Another Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is no shopping or nightlife anywhere in Kauai. Marriot stop serving drinks at pool at 4:30 everyday and everyone goes to bed at 8pm even on the weekends.
reviews.title: Prettiest Marriot I Ever Stayed At

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Many thanks to all those who share their comments on Tripadvisior. My wife and I found your comments extremely helpful and are eager to share with you our experiences for the benefit of others. This is our first post!
reviews.title: Kauai: Simply Spectacular
My favorite place ever
reviews.text: We just completed a weeklong stay at the Kauai Marriott (April 30-May 6). Everything lived up the hype: the grounds and service were simply spectacular. This was one of the nicest beach resorts we have sever stayed at. Here are our specifics—

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Arrival: Upon arriving, we walked up to the courtesy phone located next to the baggage claim, dialed “35” and the complementary shuttle was there within 5 minutes. The drive was pleasant and quick (3-5 min trip). We checked in and were upgraded to the pool view room by pulling the ole “ its our anniversary” trick (actually we were only 2 weeks off). The rooms were typical Marriott—nothing special. We did find the complaints about airplane noise laughable, however. Heard two planes during the entire 6 day vacation.
reviews.title: This place has it all!

likes.disliked: — Occasionally had to wait a few minutes for hot water to take a shower.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008
reviews.text: Weather. Even though weather.com had rain predicted everyday, we only experienced 1 10 min light rain shower during our entire stay. Admittingly, there were brief moments of cloudiness but with our skin baking for 4-6 hours at a time, the brief moments of shade were actually inviting. Trust us: despite the weather forecasts, the sun shines brightly at the Marriott as it gets hot. Ignore the weather reports--you will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: great staff, great property, great stay
Could use a paint job and upgraded rooms
reviews.text: On the second day of your stay, expect a voice mail from the vacation club personnel asking you to attend a 90 minutes sales presentation. Of course, we were skeptical at first—we had zero intentions of buying a timeshare, but when they offered a $125 gift certificate (which can be applied directly to the room bill upon check-out) or 20,000 Marriott points and 4 chocolate bars, we signed up. Helpful tip: When (or if) you go, make it clear that you pay for your vacations via Marriott points. The sales agents cannot compete with that and do not have a response (...and they admit it). Otherwise, you will be hearing about deeded titles versus throw-away money (money spent at hotels during vacations). It was the typical sales pitch and was a great source of jokes for us during the balance of our trip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort, the beach, the pool area all beautiful. The grounds look great anytime of the day. Good location, close to airport and can easily access stores and restaurants in walking distance. Water on beach calm since on lagoon off the ocean. Food at the onsite restaurant Dukes was good and ambiance enjoyable. Would stay here again.
reviews.title: Very nice resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were billeted here after our flight to the mainland was cancelled. We found the staff to be amazingly accommodating, especially considering that it was well past midnight, and they were called back in to deal with unhappy, tired, and cranky airline passengers who had been on their feet, in lines, and arguing with the airlines for several hours! We were lucky enough to be upgraded to a beautiful oceanfront suite and spent our extra day in Kauai enjoying the lovely amenities of this resort. The pool, enormous grounds, and facilities are elegant and island-beautiful! Kauai is totally amazing! If you want a resort experience, this is a great place to stay, especially if you golf! It is very close to the airport, but we experienced no noise. Also, they have facilities to shower and change after you check out, if you have a late flight. (Good to know!) We usually rent a house or condo on another part of the island, so it was a chance to enjoy another side of paradise.
reviews.title: Grand surprise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: I cannot say enough nice things about the desk staff that checked in 260-some angry people at 1am. I was at the end of the line, so I know they deserve the Nobel Peace prize!
reviews.title: Postcard Stunning!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: This place is absolutely amazing! I wish I could have stayed longer. We were here for a week with our two kids and the place was more than I had hoped for. The beach was like a movie grass and palm trees to the sand... then when you look out to the ocean you see a private lagoon with an opening to the ocean where we say whales almost every day. (we were there in January) I would wake up every morning and drink a couple pots of coffee on our balcony overlooking the ocean and beach then we would get our drink on and ride the waves! There are a couple open air bars on the beach as well... just perfect. I was a bit overwhelmed myself at how beautiful it was. If I could give it 10 filled in green circles I would!
reviews.title: So, so, no go again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013
reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Service great and pool fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a wonderful stay at the Marriott for our honeymoon. The location was a great jumping off point for all points on the island as it's centrally located. Yes, it is near the airport but we didn't hear any airplane noise to complain of. There are of course, helicopters all over the island so maybe that's the noise people were talking about in other reviews. We heard very little noise at all in our room.
reviews.title: A wonderful honeymoon spot!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose to go with a partial oceanview room, and partial really is inaccurate. There was no craning of necks off the balcony to see the ocean: it was RIGHT there (past the pool.)
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - The pool was fantastic, huge, never crowded.
reviews.title: Great property, so-so room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -The beach was very nice, right there, never crowded. The waves were mild, it wasn't very deep, but there was not really any snorkeling to be had (the water was not clear enough.)
reviews.title: Hotel, Eats, Activities and so on...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: -Self park was $9/day. We found the very close parking lot the second day we were there so why pay extra for valet. I will say that the very close lot was full one afternoon when we came back to the hotel but someone was just pulling out so we lucked out.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back!!!

likes.disliked: — Not too close to other tourist sites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location: close to Lihue airport, few minutes walk to beach.
reviews.title: Large resort with beach!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012
reviews.text: Guest rooms: nice and roomy, recently updated, balconies.
reviews.title: Great stay, would definitely come back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Restaurants: good but not fine dining.
reviews.title: Absolutely gorgeous hotel with a fantastic pool!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Gym: standard equipment, freezing so bring a jacket.
reviews.title: 2 Nighter in Lihue to Start a Vaca...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Family friendly: TOTALLY! not a quite romantic get away as there were tons of kids running around (July 2012).
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Kauai in General - My biggest gripe and surprise - Overpriced!!!everywhere we went but particularly food. Groceries were ridiculous as well. $7+ for carton of oj. Gas - $4.30 a gal. Marriott not worth the $350 a night in relative comparisons as noted above. Really not a family destination unless your kids just want to chill. Better for couples, adult groups, definitely not singles. Everywhere we went, people displayed the aloha spirit. There was never any fear of violence (though some occurred in Hanalei during our stay), no real street vendors to hassle us and really a lack of "touristy traps." Just a chill vibe. Weather - as expected - HI warm (mid 80s), humid but surprisingly bearable coming from CO. It rained somewhere on the island everyday out of 10 but particularly got washed out 1 entire day, 2 other half days...but that's the luck of the draw isn't it. Vog was a problem. That's right Vog. Been to HI 4 previous times and never heard of it until now. Something to do with lack of trades. Blocked some of the views. Snorkeling was OK in Hanalei at Tunnels (better in Maui & Oahu). Surfing was excellent along North Shore (3-6 HI feet) but again luck of the draw in May and for the experienced only. 1 decent hike near NaPali for the less adventurous (though still fairly strenous) but I am told several more back along this coast for the prepared (camping, trekking...that sort of thing). In my personal opinion, Kauai is worth only 5 full days on the ground. Extend HI vacation by island hopping... again my opinion. We kind of ran out of things to do and see so pool lounging took up a full couple days.
reviews.title: Nice hotel great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was hassle free. Found the Front Desk, Bell People and Valet agents to be very personable and hospitable.
reviews.title: Terriffic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Location: very short drive from the airport, but hardly noticed airplane traffic (didn't observe any planes flying directly overhead).
reviews.title: Beach Club Happiness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room: stayed in the Kilohana Wing - above/behind Wai'ale'ale Wing. AMAZING room was actually two adjoining rooms: one with King bed and lots of extra space, one with Murphy bed and stocked kitchen (utensils, dishes, fridge, dishwasher...) with small dining table and balcony. Excellent choice for two adults who each need their own bed and space.
reviews.title: Relaxing and Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013
reviews.text: Public Areas: Huge property with lots to explore. Landscaping - amazing. Pond and waterfall feature - stunning. Statuary - impressive. Great variety in places to chill on furniture of all descriptions (chairs, lounges, cocoons, you name it).
reviews.title: A Must Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beach: easy access to the pretty beach on a very picturesque bay. I found this view of attractive buildings, a mountain and a bay more interesting than just open water. Also saw a cruise ship sail past enroute to port, plus whales breaching offshore (with binoculars).
reviews.title: Have been coming for years

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Restaurants: evening drink at Duke's - casual, laid back and pleasant. Ate at Kukui's: the Mongolian Grill was fun, tasty and way too much to eat (includes soup, dessert bar). Had lunch at Kalapaki Grill - nice setting by mammoth pool.
reviews.title: Ocean view is not really an ocean view

description: Known for its warm island hospitality and idyllic location on the Garden Isle, the Kauai Marriott Resort on Kalapaki Beach underwent a $50 million upgrade, with major enhancements to all its guestrooms, suites, restaurants and pool deck. Unique among hotels in Kauai, our resort sits on Kalapaki Bay and offers a wide variety of recreational activities, a superior beach experience and 18 holes of Jack Nicklaus championship golf at the adjacent Kauai Lagoons Golf Club. Business travelers will enjoy our 5 Star Hotel's 20,230 sq ft of flexible meeting and event space in Kauai. Guests traveling for pleasure will enjoy one of the largest family-friendly pools in Hawaii and our spacious 5 star hotel rooms, most of which offer spectacular views and feature a balcony. Pamper yourself with a luxurious spa treatment at our hotel's on-site Alexander Spa and Salon. Discover a leader in style and service among Kauai hotels and resorts and enjoy breathtaking beachfront views at the Kauai Marriott Resort.
